claims.object: Problem concerned with mathematical representation of a system's input/output
Providing detailed inventory and understanding of physical components of systems
Providing detailed inventory and understanding of logical components of systems
Identifying physical connection properties from free and forced response test data

surface_layer.definition: System characterization involves mathematically representing a system's input/output and understanding its physical and logical components.

deep_layer.mechanism: System characterization utilizes mathematical models and data analysis techniques to understand a system's behavior and properties.
deep_layer.origin: Emerged from the need to understand and analyze complex systems in various fields.

examples: Characterizing a computer system to identify vulnerabilities.
Characterizing a mechanical system to predict its response to external forces.

citations: Characterization and Identification of Systems - DTIC
System Characterization - an overview | ScienceDirect Topics
Characterization of Structural Connections Using Free and Forced Response
